content:
Display messages in OmniScripts depending on whether a validate expression returns true or false. 

Configure the Messaging element to display validation messages. Merge fields are supported in messages.

Drag a Messaging element into the structure panel where the message must appear.

For Validate Expression, enter the expression that should be validated. You can evaluate any element or elements.

In the Messages section, select message types for when the expression evaluates as true or false and then enter messages.

Message Types:

* LWC OmniScript messages have different styling than Angular OmniScript messages.
* LWC OmniScript messages use pure SLDS styling.
* The table provides examples of both LWC OmniScript and Angular OmniScript messages.

Enable the LWC OmniScript to run validation when a user types by adding "commitOnChange": true in the Setup properties. 

In LWC OmniScripts, the onChange behavior runs after a half-second delay.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
title: Displaying Messages in OmniScripts
